snippet: The super combined was introduced to the World Cup in 2006, but it might not exist beyond next season.
abstract: World Cup skiing's super combined event was introduced in 2006, but it might not exist beyond next season; known as the super combi, it is composed of one downhill run, usually held in the morning, followed by an afternoon slalom run; some skiers and coaches say the event offers an unfair advantage to slalom skiers, is boring to watch and diminishes the battle for the World Cup overall title, which measures a skier’s performance over the season and is the sport’s top prize.
lead_paragraph: The super combined was introduced to the World Cup in 2006, but it might not exist beyond next season.

headline.seo: Opposition Puts World Cup Super-Combined Event in Peril
headline.main: Opposition Puts World Cup Super-Combined Event in Peril
headline.print_headline: Super Combined May Simply Fade Away
